Description: Pottery ostracon containing a letter written in Coptic and decorated with incised and painted geometrical patterns in red, brown ink.
Excavator/field collector: Excavated by: Henri Édouard Naville (1893-94, on behalf of EEF)
Findspot: Excavated/Findspot: Monastery of St Phoibammon, site of the temple of Mentuhotep
Bibliographic references: Godlewski 1986 / Le monastère de St Phoibammon (p.125, fig.108)
Trismegistos / An interdisciplinary portal of papyrological and epigraphic resources (390678) (http://www.trismegistos.org/text/390678)
Additional IDs: Miscellaneous number: O.Crum 248 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
Miscellaneous number: O.Deir el-Bahari dessin 39 (text edition abbreviation according to Oates et al 2001)
